alert.note: Alert for Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 08 at 6:53PM EDT until August 08 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL OXFORD AND SOUTHEASTERN COOS COUNTIES... At 652 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Berlin, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Berlin, Bethel, Andover, Errol, Grafton, Gorham, Dummer, Hanover, Gilead, Milan, Upton, Shelburne, Newry, Riley, Randolph, Magalloway Plantation and Stark. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
